metadata.title: CVE-2024-42284 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:tipc: Return non-zero value from tipc_udp_addr2str() on errortipc_udp_addr2str() should return non-zero value if the UDP mediaaddress is invalid. Otherwise, a buffer overflow access can occur intipc_media_addr_printf(). Fix this by returning 1 on an invalid UDPmedia address.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-42284` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-230-generic - 4.15.0-230.242
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-230-generic - 4.15.0-230.242
